channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Did Imran Khan’s spiritual wife, Bushra Bibi, practice ‘black magic’?
From Saudi to Maldives through Trump: All about the US president's new luxury resort
In Graphics | What is the Overton window?
Solid gold American toilet sells for Rs 106 crore at auction. What we know
Should the US-Saudi security agreement worry India?
Did Al-Falah University, under scanner after Delhi blast, dupe students of crores?
Lessons from America’s handling of the exiled Shah: Why India should stand firm on Sheikh Hasina
item.description: To appease Yunus and his Islamist backers would be no more effective than Carter’s appeasement was toward Khomeini with regard to the future trajectory of relations.

item.title: G20 summit in South Africa: How last four presidencies have steered the Global South agenda
item.description: The gains for the Global South have been significant during the last four G20 presidencies and hopefully the momentum will be maintained.

item.title: Congress blames everyone but itself: Voter-list politics masks leadership crisis
item.description: The grand old party is outsourcing excuses for electoral failures instead of introspecting, revealing a leadership that has lost the pulse of the nation

item.title: How Sheikh Hasina’s extradition is a diplomatic tightrope for India
item.description: India withholding Sheikh Hasina’s extradition could strain ties with Bangladesh’s interim government but is unlikely to break relations; the 2026 elections will significantly shape the future of bilateral relations

item.title: G20 Johannesburg summit: How to sail the age of polycrisis?
item.description: Working in isolation, neither the Global North nor the Global South can resolve the world’s problems

item.title: What Delhi can learn from Beijing in fighting air pollution
item.description: Beijing provides a model for New Delhi. Through strict multi-faceted measures, including urban rail expansion, satellite monitoring, electric vehicles, and low emission zones, the Chinese capital reduced air pollution by up to 89 per cent in a decade despite tripling vehicle numbers
